title: Silesian language
summary: Silesian[lower-alpha 1] or Upper Silesian is a West Slavic lect of the Lechitic group,[2] spoken in Silesia. Its vocabulary was significantly influenced by Central German due to the existence of numerous Silesian German speakers in the area prior to World War II and after.[4] Some regard it as one of the four major dialects of Polish,[5][6][7][8] while others classify it as a separate language, distinct from Polish.[9][10][11][12][13]
